Render
Class TextRenderer

java.lang.Object
  Render.TextRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModelVisitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTMLTextRenderer, JSONRenderer, JUnitRenderer, KMLRenderer, SimpleTextRenderer, TextTreeRenderer
public class TextRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModelVisitor

A superclass for rendering BiSciCol data into text-based formats. This class implements functionality common to all text rendering. Subclasses supporting specific text formats (e.g., XML, JSON, etc.) will need to provide implementations of printEnterObject() and printLeaveObject().

visitEnter

public boolean visitEnter(BSCObject obj,
                          int depth,
                          int obj_cnt)
Description copied from interface: ModelVisitor
Notify the visitor that it is entering obj.

Specified by:
visitEnter in interface ModelVisitor
Parameters:
obj - The BSCObject this visitor is entering.
depth - The distance of obj from the BSCObject at which the traversal began.
obj_cnt - The position of obj among its siblings.
Returns:
Whether or not to continue the traversal at the next level (e.g., depth + 1) beyond obj.

Specified by:
visitLeave in interface ModelVisitor
Parameters:
obj - The BSCObject this visitor is leaving.
depth - The distance of obj from the BSCObject at which the traversal began.
obj_cnt - The position of obj among its siblings.

printStats

public java.lang.String printStats()

renderObject

public java.lang.String renderObject(BSCObject obj)
Generates a textual representation of a BSCObject. All descendents of the object are included up to the depth specified by maxdepth (as set by the constructor or setMaxDepth()).

Parameters:
obj - The BSCObject to render as text.
Returns:
A string containing the specified object rendered as text.

renderObjAncestors

public java.lang.String renderObjAncestors(BSCObject obj)
Generates a textual representation of a BSCObject and its ancestors (e.g., its parents, the parents' parents, etc.). All ancestors of the object are included up to the depth specified by maxdepth (as set by the constructor or setMaxDepth()).

Parameters:
obj - The BSCObject to render as text (along with its ancestors).
Returns:
A string containing the specified object rendered as text.

renderAll

public java.lang.String renderAll(BSCObject obj)
Render all ancestors, descendents, siblings... This method is useful for finding things like available geo coordinates to map

Parameters:
obj -
Returns:

renderObjectList

public java.lang.String renderObjectList(BSCObjectIter objiter)
Generates a textual respresentation of a list of BSCObjects accessed by objiter.

Parameters:
objiter - An iterator for the BSCObjects.
Returns:
A string containing the objects rendered as text.

printEnterObject

protected java.lang.String printEnterObject(BSCObject obj,
                                            int depth,
                                            int obj_cnt)
Generates text for the "opening" of a BSCObject. This method is intended to be overridden by child classes of TextRenderer.

Parameters:
obj - The object to render.
depth - The depth of obj in the traversal (0 = top).
obj_cnt - The position of obj among its siblings (0 = 1st).
Returns:
A textual respresentation of the "opening" of obj.

printLeaveObject

protected java.lang.String printLeaveObject(BSCObject obj,
                                            int depth,
                                            int obj_cnt)
Generates text for the "closing" of a BSCObject. This method is intended to be overridden by child classes of TextRenderer.

Parameters:
obj - The object to render.
depth - The depth of obj in the traversal (0 = top).
obj_cnt - The position of obj among its siblings (0 = 1st).
Returns:
A textual respresentation of the "closing" of obj.
